questions.question: 1. What does the C-V characterization of a PMOS capacitor measure?

answers.a: The current as a function of voltage
answers.b: The capacitance as a function of voltage
answers.c: The resistance as a function of current
answers.d: The power as a function of voltage

questions.question: 2. In which region does the capacitance approach the oxide capacitance (C_ox) in a PMOS capacitor?
3. What happens to the capacitance in the depletion region of a PMOS capacitor?

answers.b: It decreases due to the formation of a depletion layer
answers.d: It oscillates with the applied voltage

questions.question: 4. What does the threshold voltage (V_T) indicate in the C-V characterization of a PMOS capacitor?

answers.a: The voltage at which the capacitor begins to conduct current
answers.b: The voltage at which significant inversion occurs
answers.c: The voltage at which the oxide breaks down
answers.d: The voltage at which accumulation starts

questions.question: 5. How does the doping concentration affect the C-V curve of a PMOS capacitor?

answers.c: It only affects the oxide capacitance
answers.d: It changes the metal work function

answers.a: It indicates the onset of inversion

answers.c: It represents the voltage at which the oxide capacitance reaches its maximum
